memberdef.name: DECLARE_STATE_TYPE_AUX
memberdef.initializer: template<> \ struct State_traits<constness State> \ { \ static constexpr bool is_state = true; \ static constexpr int nvars = N; \ template< int I > \ KOKKOS_INLINE_FUNCTION \ static constness real_t& get(constness State& s) \ { \ static_assert(I!=I, "Missing variable in state `" #State "`, add it with DECLARE_STATE_GET()"); \ static real_t res = 0; \ return res; \ } \ }; \

memberdef.name: DECLARE_STATE_TYPE
memberdef.initializer: DECLARE_STATE_TYPE_AUX( , State, N ); \ DECLARE_STATE_TYPE_AUX( const , State, N ); \

briefdescription.para: DECLARE_STATE_TYPE() declares State as a State and State_traits<State>::is_state == true;.

memberdef.name: DECLARE_STATE_GET_AUX
memberdef.initializer: template<> KOKKOS_INLINE_FUNCTION real_t& State_traits<State>::get<I>( State& s ) { return expr; } \ template<> KOKKOS_INLINE_FUNCTION const real_t& State_traits<const State>::get<I>( const State& s ) { return expr; } \

briefdescription.para: Associates index I to field s.var (State Must be declared as a State with DECLARE_STATE_TYPE() before )
Get field with index I form s (index associated with DECLARE_STATE_GET())
Get field with index I form s (index associated with DECLARE_STATE_GET()), const version.

detaileddescription.para:
Iterate over each member variable for a set of states
I
start index (mainly here for metaprogramming purpose)
states...
states to read or modify. They can be const or not. Mixing state types is not advised
f
function to apply to each field in states of type f : (real_t(&), real_t(&), ...) -> void one real_t for each const State& in states... one real& for each State& in states e.g. state_foreach_var( [](real_t&, real_t, real_t){...}, State&, const State&, const State& );
